etymologies: Old English spreawlian ‘move the limbs convulsively’; related to Danish sprælle ‘kick or splash about’. The noun dates from the early 18th century

definitions: sit, lie, or fall with one's arms and legs spread out in an ungainly or awkward way

examples.text: the door shot open, sending him sprawling across the pavement
she lay sprawled on the bed

shortDefinitions: sit, lie, or fall with one's arms and legs spread out in ungainly way

definitions: spread out over a large area in an untidy or irregular way

examples.text: the town sprawled along several miles of cliff top

shortDefinitions: spread out over large area in untidy or irregular way

definitions: an ungainly or carelessly relaxed position in which one's arms and legs are spread out

examples.text: she fell into a sort of luxurious sprawl

shortDefinitions: ungainly or carelessly relaxed position in which one's arms and legs are spread out

definitions: a group or mass of something that has spread out in an untidy or irregular way
shortDefinitions: group or mass of something that has spread out in untidy or irregular way

definitions: the expansion of an urban or industrial area into the adjoining countryside in a way perceived to be disorganized and unattractive
shortDefinitions: disorganized and unattractive expansion of urban or industrial area into adjoining countryside
